intro: Cheiridopsis candidissima, commonly known as the white-flowered ice plant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring, adding a delicate touch to its appearance. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its drought tolerance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid gardens.
